The second training rule on laughing loudly

original: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā sāvatthiyaṁ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
analyzed: tena samayena buddhaḥ bhagavā sāvatthiyam viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme
translated: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,

original: Tena kho pana samayena chabbaggiyā bhikkhū mahāhasitaṁ hasantā antaraghare nisīdanti …pe….
analyzed: tena kho pana samayena chabbaggiyāḥ bhikkhū mahāhasitam hasantāḥ antara ghare nisīdanti pe
translated: the monks from the group of six were sitting in inhabited areas laughing loudly, making a loud ruckus.

analyzed: na ujjagghikāya antaraghare nisīdissāmi iti sikkhā karaṇīyā ati
translated: “‘I will not sit in inhabited areas laughing loudly,’ this is how you should train.”
One should not sit in inhabited areas laughing loudly.

original: Yo anādariyaṁ paṭicca mahāhasitaṁ hasanto antaraghare nisīdati, āpatti dukkaṭassa.🔽Anāpatti—🔽asañcicca,
analyzed: yaḥ anādariyam paṭicca mahāhasitam hasantaḥ antaraghare nisīdati āpatti dukkaṭassa  anāpatti  a san cit ca
translated: If a monk, out of disrespect, sits in an inhabited area laughing loudly, making a loud ruckus, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
There is no offense if it is unintentional,
if he is not thinking,🔽if he does not know,
if he is the first offender.🔽The second training rule is finished.
